Film rentals” account for 50 percent of ticket sales (called “boxoffice gross” in North America), about half the world market. Because of government tax on tickets, it accounts for only a third in Italy, and 10 percent in the world market overall. a large audience applauded as she explained that her broadcast had made all the difference in finding out the truth about the crime. In 2015, a decade after the program, Calvi still believed what he did in 1975: that Pasolini’s was a “political” murder, orchestrated by high-level officials working with trusted accomplices in the criminal underworld. He believed that a “group of fascists” were behind the conspiracy to beat up Pasolini—persons known to Pelosi
